action: .old의 problems/dag/dag_progress/skills.ui JSON을 기본 경로로 이동하거나 기본값을 수정하고, 미존재 시 안전한 fallback 처리

action: Redact or remove response body previews from api.ts error logging and route sensitive diagnostics to secured telemetry instead of the browser console.

risks: Plain SHA-256 hashing without salt in app/routers/practice.py:87-101 leaves stored passwords trivial to brute-force and reuse if the SQLite file leaks.

SESSION_TOKEN_SECRET ships with the hardcoded default "calculate-dev-secret" and SESSION_COOKIE_SECURE defaults to False (tasks/2025-12-02-1_backend_enhanced.md:297-304) while cookies are emitted with only SameSite=Lax (app/routers/practice.py:91-101), exposing session tokens on any HTTP/mixed-content deployment.

/api/v1/login auto-creates accounts and has no throttling or lockouts in app/routers/practice.py:292-348, so attackers can brute-force credentials, enumerate nicknames, or spam account creation without any audit trail.

Frontend error logging echoes up to 200 bytes of server response payloads to the browser console (frontend/src/utils/api.ts:41-58), which can leak PII or stack traces to any user with DevTools access.

artifacts_out.note: Threat model
Security review report

action: Force secure session handling by requiring SESSION_TOKEN_SECRET from a secrets manager, rotating existing secrets, making SESSION_COOKIE_SECURE=True and SameSite=Strict by default, and rejecting startups without HTTPS.

action: Add regression tests + telemetry for skill tree layout/data fallbacks before shipping.
Introduce per-IP/user login rate limiting plus structured authentication audit logs routed to SIEM for detection of brute-force attempts.

risks: Password storage in app/routers/practice.py:90 still uses unsalted SHA-256, enabling offline brute force if the user table is leaked.
Session cookies are issued with SESSION_COOKIE_SECURE defaulting to false in app/config.py:155-158 and no SameSite enforcement, exposing tokens on insecure transports and to CSRF.
Login endpoint lacks rate limiting or tamper-proof audit logging, so credential stuffing can proceed undetected and without traceability.

artifacts_out.note: Update with revised authentication and session management data flows once mitigations land.
Document bcrypt/Argon2 migration, cookie policy, and rate-limit validation results for release sign-off.

artifacts_out.note: pytest -q

action: Restore app/routers/practice.py with real FastAPI code implementing Argon2id hashing, HTTPS-only cookie issuance, and login rate limiting, then rerun pytest/make smoke to prove the controls.

risks: app/routers/practice.py:1 still contains the literal diff output, so the module will not import and none of the Argon2 hashing, HTTPS-only cookie, or rate limiting logic actually executes—login security requirements remain unmet.

tests/test_api.py:1 and tests/test_skills_router.py:1 are also diff stubs, meaning the promised regression tests for Argon2 migration, HTTPS cookie enforcement, and fallback telemetry cannot even run, leaving us without evidence for requirement #2.

docs/SECURITY_REPORT.md:3-17 and docs/THREAT_MODEL.md:11-22 attest that Argon2 hashing, secure SameSite cookies, and per-IP rate limiting are enforced even though the codebase is non-functional, creating a compliance/audit exposure.

app/config.py:170 still defaults PASSWORD_PEPPER to the public string "calculate-pepper"; if operators forget to override it, every Argon2 hash would share a known pepper, weakening credential storage.

artifacts_out.note: Claims Argon2/HTTPS-only controls are live (lines 11-22) even though the router is non-executable; update once fixes land.
States Argon2 hashing + rate limiting shipped (lines 3-17) despite missing implementation; revise after remediation.
